newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatia's Tudjman wins presidential vote-radio.
newsitem.headline: Croatia's Tudjman wins presidential vote-radio.

text.p: President Franjo Tudjman has won Croatia's presidential election, unofficial results broadcast on Croatian radio said on Monday.
With just over 90 percent of the votes counted, Tudjman had 61.2 percent, the state electoral commission said. Results will be made official at a later date.
Zdravko Tomac of the Social Democratic party was in second place with 21.12 percent and Vlado Gotovac of the Social Liberal party was in third place with 17.67 percent.
Turnout was 57 percent, officials said at a news conference. Both opposition candidates have highlighted the low figure which they said was worrying.
Final results were expected later on Monday.
Tudjman is now sure of five more years in power and has pledged to dedicate himself to improving living standards for the whole population.
